'0 A B I N E T.THE DEFENCE OF INDIA.Note by the Secretary.The Prime Minister thinks that, the Cabinet would like to see the enclosed Minutes of the 223rd Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence, held on March 17th, 1927, as the result of which a Sub-Committee has been set up, under the Chairmanship of the Secretary of State for India, to enquire into the question of the Defence of India.If any member of the Cabinet wishes to see copies of the Papers already circulated to the Committee of Imperial Defence on this subject, they will be forwarded on receipt of a notification to the Secretary..It is particularly requested that these Minutes may be returned when finished with.(Signed) M.P.A.HANKEY, Secretary, Cabinet.2, Whitehall Gardens,, S.W.1, March 22, 1927.k Wot attached in the case of Ministers who receive the Minutes as members of the Committee of Imperial Defence.
